trans-unit.source: DSC for Linux nxPackage Resource
trans-unit.target: DSC for Linux nxPackage Resource

trans-unit.source: The **nxPackage** resource in PowerShell Desired State Configuration (DSC) provides a mechanism to manage packages on a Linux node.
trans-unit.target: The **nxPackage** resource in PowerShell Desired State Configuration (DSC) provides a mechanism to manage packages on a Linux node.

trans-unit.source: Syntax
trans-unit.target: Syntax

trans-unit.source: Properties
trans-unit.target: Properties

trans-unit.source: Property
trans-unit.target: Property

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: Name
trans-unit.target: Name

trans-unit.source: The name of the package for which you want to ensure a specific state.
trans-unit.target: The name of the package for which you want to ensure a specific state.

trans-unit.source: Ensure
trans-unit.target: Ensure

trans-unit.source: Determines whether to check if the package exists.
trans-unit.target: Determines whether to check if the package exists.

trans-unit.source: Set this property to "Present" to ensure the package exists.
trans-unit.target: Set this property to "Present" to ensure the package exists.

trans-unit.source: Set it to "Absent" to ensure the package does not exist.
trans-unit.target: Set it to "Absent" to ensure the package does not exist.

trans-unit.source: The default value is "Present".
trans-unit.target: The default value is "Present".

trans-unit.source: PackageManager
trans-unit.target: PackageManager

trans-unit.source: Supported values are "yum", "apt", and "zypper".
trans-unit.target: Supported values are "yum", "apt", and "zypper".

trans-unit.source: Specifies the package manager to use when installing packages.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the package manager to use when installing packages.

trans-unit.source: If **FilePath** is specified, the provided path will be used to install the package.
trans-unit.target: If **FilePath** is specified, the provided path will be used to install the package.

trans-unit.source: Otherwise, a Package Manager will be used to install the package from a pre-configured repository.
trans-unit.target: Otherwise, a Package Manager will be used to install the package from a pre-configured repository.

trans-unit.source: If neither **PackageManager** nor **FilePath** are provided, the default package manager for the system will be used.
trans-unit.target: If neither **PackageManager** nor **FilePath** are provided, the default package manager for the system will be used.

trans-unit.source: FilePath
trans-unit.target: FilePath

trans-unit.source: The file path where the package resides
trans-unit.target: The file path where the package resides

trans-unit.source: PackageGroup
trans-unit.target: PackageGroup

trans-unit.source: If **$true**, the **Name** is expected to be the name of a package group for use with a **PackageManager**.
trans-unit.target: If **$true**, the **Name** is expected to be the name of a package group for use with a **PackageManager**.

trans-unit.source: **PacakgeGroup** is not valid when providing a **FilePath**.
trans-unit.target: **PacakgeGroup** is not valid when providing a **FilePath**.

trans-unit.source: Arguments
trans-unit.target: Arguments

trans-unit.source: A string of arguments that will be passed to the package exactly as provided.
trans-unit.target: A string of arguments that will be passed to the package exactly as provided.

trans-unit.source: ReturnCode
trans-unit.target: ReturnCode

trans-unit.source: The expected return code.
trans-unit.target: The expected return code.

trans-unit.source: If the actual return code does not match the expected value provided here, the configuration will return an error.
trans-unit.target: If the actual return code does not match the expected value provided here, the configuration will return an error.

trans-unit.source: DependsOn
trans-unit.target: DependsOn

trans-unit.source: Indicates that the configuration of another resource must run before this resource is configured.
trans-unit.target: Indicates that the configuration of another resource must run before this resource is configured.

trans-unit.source: For example, if the **ID** of the resource configuration script block that you want to run first is **ResourceName** and its type is **ResourceType**, the syntax for using this property is `DependsOn = "[ResourceType]ResourceName"`.
trans-unit.target: For example, if the **ID** of the resource configuration script block that you want to run first is **ResourceName** and its type is **ResourceType**, the syntax for using this property is `DependsOn = "[ResourceType]ResourceName"`.

trans-unit.source: Example
trans-unit.target: Example

trans-unit.source: The following example ensures that the package named "httpd" is installed on a Linux computer, using the “Yum” package manager.
trans-unit.target: The following example ensures that the package named "httpd" is installed on a Linux computer, using the “Yum” package manager.
